oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Spring Hill Cemetery: McKissack graves
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Eatherly, Brad, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Color photograph of three tombstones for members of the McKissack family. The stone on the left reads "In memory of Col, William McKissack, who was born in Caswell County N. Carolina Nov' 14' 1781 And Died in Maury County Tennessee Feby' 28th 1855 Aged 73 years 3 months & 14 days." The middle stone reads "In memory of Jannet S.C.E. McKissack, Daughter of James & Susan Thompson and Wife of Col. Wm McKissack. Was Born in Person County, North Carolina Nov. 15, 1803 And Died in Maury County Tennessee the 14 day of May 1842 Aged 38 years 5 months & 15 days." The right stone reads "In memory of William McKissack Infant son of William and Jannet McKissack, Was Born April 2, 1842 & Died April 4, 1843 Aged 11 months & 28 days."

The Spring Hill Cemetery is the principle cemetery used by the city of Spring Hill, Tennessee. It has been in operation since 1840 and is the final resting place for many Spring Hill and Maury County families. Members of the McKissack and Cheairs families are laid to rest here. It is also the final resting place for twenty-five Confederate soldiers who died during the Battles of Spring Hill and Thompson's Station. A memorial was recently presented recognizing the Confederate soldiers who died during these battles.
